intro: Lunathyrium × lobatocrenatum, commonly known as the hybrid mooncup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Lunathyrium lobatum and Lunathyrium crenatum, characterized by its distinctive, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are compound, with a lobed or crenate margin, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptability.
